trial_identification.studytitle: Clinical Evaluation of the AqueSys Implant for the Treatment of ocular hypertension and open angle glaucoma
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Clinical evaluation of the safety and effectiveness of the AqueSys implant in participants with poorly controlled intraocular pressure

conditions.healthcondition: Ocular hypertension and open angle glaucoma

interventions.interventions: The AqueSys Implant is implanted in the eye and is intended for the treatment of open angle glaucoma and ocular hypertension. The preloaded needle is inserted through the cornea and the needle is directed across the anterior chamber and implanted in the target quadrant of the eye. The implantation procedure will take approximately 30 minutes. The implant will remain permanently or until it is removed.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Safety and Effectiveness. Effectiveness will be evaluated by comparing baseline intraocular pressure values to postoperative values.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Post operative values taken at 1 day, 1 week, 2 week, 1 month, 3 month, 6 month, 9 month and 1 year.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Suitability of study procedure for use based on the successful application of the device.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Subjects with poorly controlled intraocular pressure.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: 1. Angle Closure Glaucoma 2. Congenital or other secondary glaucomas developed as a complication of other medical conditions

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: 26970 Aliso Viejo Parkway, Suite 200, Aliso Viejo, California 92656

fundingsource.fundingaddress: 26970 Aliso Viejo Parkway, Suite 200, Aliso Viejo, California 92656

secondarysponsor.sponsoraddress: PACIFIC CLINICAL RESEARCH GROUP COURIER ADDRESS: 1 CASSINS AVENUE, SUITE G03 NORTH SYDNEY, NSW 2060 AUSTRALIA

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The primary objective of the study is to evaluate the safety and effectiveness of the AqueSys Implant for the treatment of ocular hypertension and open angle glaucoma.
